page.title: 11 A SOUTH-AYR COUNCILLOR
page.content: District Councillor Campbell Howie, last Provost of the Royal Burgh of Ayr,is one of 25 District Councillors for the{Kyle and Carrick District} which has a population of{c.110 000. A district councillor serves on many committees e.g.General Purposes (Licensing)and Environmental Services (Rubbish Collection). One of the most important committees is the Housing Committee. Currently the Leisure and Recreation Committee is considering plans for a new golf course at Greenan. The District Council works on a five week cycle. Conservation of Ayr's natural beauty is thought by Mr.Howie to be of prime importance. In conclusion the Councillor stated,"The councillors have many arguments but they all try to do their best for the district."
